New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers became the first team in NBA history to win their first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them.
Cleveland also set a franchise record with a 41-point halftime lead at 83-42 — tying the eighth largest in the NBA’s shot clock era.
Cleveland equaled its mark for points in a half.
Key Match Events: Garland made a pair of 3-pointers and Mobley scored six points as the Cavaliers grabbed a 20-2 lead.
Golden State missed eight of its first nine field goal attempts and Green picked up two fouls in the first 5:39.
The Cavaliers took a 41-point lead at halftime, the largest halftime lead in the NBA’s shot clock era.
